pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw:
The sensors appear to be implemented correctly.  I could not test your model yet as localMode is not currently compatible \(it should work from `ign launch example.ign robotName:=whatever` while in `…/src/subt_robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/submitted_models/robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/launch` whenever you have everything configured correctly\).

‌

For some of the issues listed, I recommend checking [#!/osrf/subt/branch/submitted\_models/x2\_sensor\_config\_7](#!/osrf/subt/branch/submitted_models/x2_sensor_config_7) for an example.

‌
content.html:
The sensors appear to be implemented correctly. I could not test your model yet as localMode is not currently compatible (it should work from ign launch example.ign robotName:=whatever while in …/src/subt_robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/submitted_models/robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/launch whenever you have everything configured correctly).

‌

For some of the issues listed, I recommend checking #!/osrf/subt/branch/submitted_models/x2_sensor_config_7 for an example.

‌

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw:
`<uri>` tags in `model.sdf` need to be relative

* i.e. `<uri>model://robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/meshes/x2_chassis.dae</uri>` to `<uri>meshes/x2_chassis.dae</uri>`

‌
content.html:
<uri> tags in model.sdf need to be relative

  • i.e. <uri>model://robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/meshes/x2_chassis.dae</uri> to <uri>meshes/x2_chassis.dae</uri>

‌

content.html:

‌

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw: Can you please explain how? I would suppose that pose is 6D \(x, y, z and angles\)??
content.html: Can you please explain how? I would suppose that pose is 6D (x, y, z and angles)??

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw:
From an X2 example: `<pose>#{_x} #{_y} #{_z+0.063494} #{_roll} #{_pitch} #{_yaw}</pose>`

Remember the function prototype is `def spawner(_name, _modelURI, _worldName, _x, _y, _z, _roll, _pitch, _yaw)`
content.html:
From an X2 example: <pose>#{_x} #{_y} #{_z+0.063494} #{_roll} #{_pitch} #{_yaw}</pose>

Remember the function prototype is def spawner(_name, _modelURI, _worldName, _x, _y, _z, _roll, _pitch, _yaw)

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw: The `<uri>` tag needs to be parameterized to deal with local models.
content.html: The <uri> tag needs to be parameterized to deal with local models.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw: Arthur, can you please describe how to refer to local models? This is surely the source that “it tries to download something from ignition”. Thanks a lot
content.html: Arthur, can you please describe how to refer to local models? This is surely the source that “it tries to download something from ignition”. Thanks a lot

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw: The function prototype is `def spawner(_name, _modelURI, _worldName, _x, _y, _z, _roll, _pitch, _yaw)` where `_modelURI` is the parameter used to deal with dynamic model location. The line should be: `<uri>#{_modelURI}</uri>`
content.html: The function prototype is def spawner(_name, _modelURI, _worldName, _x, _y, _z, _roll, _pitch, _yaw) where _modelURI is the parameter used to deal with dynamic model location. The line should be: <uri>#{_modelURI}</uri>

content.html: Add gas sensor.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw: Any particular reason you decided to use a 16:9 resolution on your RGBD camera? The RGBD cameras used supplied are all 4:3, just curious here.
content.html: Any particular reason you decided to use a 16:9 resolution on your RGBD camera? The RGBD cameras used supplied are all 4:3, just curious here.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw: It is based on Intel Realsense D435i which provides resolutions “Up to 1280 x 720” which is what we are using on real robots.
content.html: It is based on Intel Realsense D435i which provides resolutions “Up to 1280 x 720” which is what we are using on real robots.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw: Please add `worlds/example.sdf` from [here](#!/osrf/subt/src/urban_circuit/submitted_models/explorer_x1_sensor_config_1/worlds/example.sdf) to pair with your `example.ign` launch file.
content.html: Please add worlds/example.sdf from here to pair with your example.ign launch file.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw:
This needs to be populated with more information, i.e.,

```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<model>
  <name>X4 Config 6</name>
  <version>1.0</version>
  <sdf version="1.6">model.sdf</sdf>

  <author>
    <name>name</name>
    <email>email@email.com</email>
  </author>

  <description>
    X4 UAV with sensor configuration #6: VGA RGBD camera, IMU, pressure sensor, magnetometer, ceiling point sensor, floor point sensor.
  </description>
</model>
```

‌
content.html:
This needs to be populated with more information, i.e.,

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<model>
  <name>X4 Config 6</name>
  <version>1.0</version>
  <sdf version="1.6">model.sdf</sdf>

  <author>
    <name>name</name>
    <email>email@email.com</email>
  </author>

  <description>
    X4 UAV with sensor configuration #6: VGA RGBD camera, IMU, pressure sensor, magnetometer, ceiling point sensor, floor point sensor.
  </description>
</model>

‌

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw:
@{557058:490c665b-b69c-40f3-80ea-64f20747efc4}  it appears I've made a mistake.  The relative paths you originally had in your `robot_from_sdf.xacro` and `robot_from_sdf.urdf` were correct and working in RViz.  If you could revert to the relative paths you had previously, it would be appreciative.  I apologize for the confusion!


i.e. I made these changes to get it back working in `robot_from_sdf.xacro`
```
diff -r 59a32aa6ac6c submitted_models/robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/urdf/robot_from_sdf.urdf
--- a/submitted_models/robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/urdf/robot_from_sdf.urdf	Thu Dec 12 00:11:02 2019 +0100
+++ b/submitted_models/robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/urdf/robot_from_sdf.urdf	Wed Dec 11 23:11:49 2019 -0500
@@ -15,7 +15,7 @@
     <visual name='chassis_visual'>
       <origin xyz='0 0 -0.0655' rpy='1.5708 0 -1.5708'/>
       <geometry>
-        <mesh filename='package:meshes/x2_chassis.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
+        <mesh filename='package://robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/meshes/x2_chassis.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
       </geometry>
     </visual>
     <visual name='navsat_visual_1'>
@@ -27,25 +27,25 @@
     <visual name='center_left_headlight_visual'>
       <origin xyz='0.22 0.05 0.0845' rpy='0 0 -3.14159'/>
       <geometry>
-        <mesh filename='package:meshes/headlight.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
+        <mesh filename='package://robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/meshes/headlight.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
       </geometry>
     </visual>
     <visual name='left_headlight_visual'>
       <origin xyz='0.22 0.145 0.0845' rpy='0 0 -3.14159'/>
       <geometry>
-        <mesh filename='package:meshes/headlight.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
+        <mesh filename='package://robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/meshes/headlight.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
       </geometry>
     </visual>
     <visual name='center_right_headlight_visual'>
       <origin xyz='0.22 -0.05 0.0845' rpy='0 0 -3.14159'/>
       <geometry>
-        <mesh filename='package:meshes/headlight.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
+        <mesh filename='package://robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/meshes/headlight.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
       </geometry>
     </visual>
     <visual name='right_headlight_visual'>
       <origin xyz='0.22 -0.145 0.0845' rpy='0 0 -3.14159'/>
       <geometry>
-        <mesh filename='package:meshes/headlight.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
+        <mesh filename='package://robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/meshes/headlight.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
       </geometry>
     </visual>
     <visual name='camera_visual'>
@@ -91,7 +91,7 @@
     <visual name='visual'>
       <origin xyz='0 0 0' rpy='1.5708 -0 0'/>
       <geometry>
-        <mesh filename='package:meshes/x2_wheel_left.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
+        <mesh filename='package://robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/meshes/x2_wheel_left.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
       </geometry>
     </visual>
   </link>
@@ -110,7 +110,7 @@

       <origin xyz='0 0 0' rpy='1.5708 -0 0'/>
       <geometry>
-        <mesh filename='package:meshes/x2_wheel_right.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
+        <mesh filename='package://robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/meshes/x2_wheel_right.dae' scale='1 1 1'/>
```

content.html:
@Martin Dlouhy it appears I've made a mistake. The relative paths you originally had in your robot_from_sdf.xacro and robot_from_sdf.urdf were correct and working in RViz. If you could revert to the relative paths you had previously, it would be appreciative. I apologize for the confusion!

i.e. I made these changes to get it back working in robot_from_sdf.xacro

content.raw:
The two commits to revert seem to be:
https://bitbucket.org/robotikacz/subt_robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/commits/cc289d215a00c65af2dfe27ee9d30939c485962e?at=urban_circuit
https://bitbucket.org/robotikacz/subt_robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/commits/1dc95954aefdb8bd8376d9344eefc6727b3b9d48?at=urban_circuit

Again, I apologize.

I'll go ahead and approve this PR, it still needs to go through OSRF's validation tests though before other reviewers merge it (as Alfredo said before).  From what I've seen, you shouldn't have much to worry about.
content.html:
The two commits to revert seem to be: https://bitbucket.org/robotikacz/subt_robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/commits/cc289d215a00c65af2dfe27ee9d30939c485962e?at=urban_circuit https://bitbucket.org/robotikacz/subt_robotika_x2_sensor_config_1/commits/1dc95954aefdb8bd8376d9344eefc6727b3b9d48?at=urban_circuit

Again, I apologize.

I'll go ahead and approve this PR, it still needs to go through OSRF's validation tests though before other reviewers merge it (as Alfredo said before). From what I've seen, you shouldn't have much to worry about.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw: Please check that your sensor parameters match [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/api](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/api) and [example models](#!/osrf/subt/src/urban_circuit/submitted_models/x3_sensor_config_5/model.sdf). For example, VGA RGBD camera has 640x480 resolution.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X2 sensor configuration 1 from Robotika.

content.raw: Yes, note that it is not only the resolution but also the field of view to be as close as possible to the real devices.
content.html: Yes, note that it is not only the resolution but also the field of view to be as close as possible to the real devices.

content.raw: Actually, this change was not included as part of the PR request description and is not a significant change to the existing RGBD camera \(which has 640x480 resolution and 60-degree FoV\). Please make this match the parameters of the VGA RGBD camera.
